user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UT_ClearStubEntry:
```c
static void UT_ClearStubEntry(UT_StubTableEntry_t *StubPtr)
{
    /* Be sure to call free() on any malloc'ed buffers before clearing */
    if ((StubPtr->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_DATA_BUFFER || StubPtr->EntryType == UT_ENTRYTYPE_RETURN_BUFFER) &&
        StubPtr->Data.Buff.BasePtr != NULL && (StubPtr->ModeFlags & UT_MODEFLAG_ALLOC_BUF) != 0)
    {
        free(StubPtr->Data.Buff.BasePtr);
    }
    memset(StubPtr, 0, sizeof(*StubPtr));
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function UT_ClearStubEntry:
#define UT_MODEFLAG_ALLOC_BUF 0x1U
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code. Specific items that might be mistaken for extensions but are standard C and therefore do not trigger MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2: 

- The static function specifier (static void UT_ClearStubEntry(...)) is standard C linkage/storage-class.
- The NULL macro and pointer comparisons (BasePtr != NULL) are standard.
- The bitwise operator and mask check ((StubPtr->ModeFlags & UT_MODEFLAG_ALLOC_BUF) != 0) are standard C.
- The integer suffix 0x1U is standard C numeric literal syntax.
- Using sizeof(*StubPtr) is standard C; sizeof can take an expression and is not a language extension.
- The calls to free() and memset() are standard C library functions, not compiler language extensions.
- Comments (/* ... */) and the if/then syntax are standard C constructs.

No compiler-specific keywords or constructs are present (for example: no __attribute__, __asm, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), inline assembly, or other vendor-specific extensions). Therefore there are no fragments that need investigation for Rule 1.2.
